snippet: A trip to Europe persuaded the conservative senator Nelson W. Aldrich, who had been opposed to a central bank, to lay the groundwork for what became the Fed.
abstract: Roger Lowenstein Hindsight column profiles conservative senator Nelson W Aldrich, who played pivotal role in founding of Federal Reserve in early 20th century; after fact-finding tour of central banking systems of Europe, he helped devise plan for central bank that worked on hub-and-spoke model; Federal Reserve Act borrowed his idea in creating Fed.
lead_paragraph: A trip to Europe persuaded the conservative senator Nelson W. Aldrich, who had been opposed to a central bank, to lay the groundwork for what became the Fed.

headline.print_headline: The Central Bank Skeptic Who Helped Form the Fed
headline.main: The Central Bank Skeptic Who Helped Give Birth to the Fed
